ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class is about radiative process only as they pertain to stellar atmospheres and more specifically as they relate to high resolution stellar spectra. If a student was interested in doing exoplanet research, I would recommend it with the caveat that it was not particularly well taught and they will probably just a well off reading the book. All other students looking to attend a course on radiative transfer and process, please look elsewhere.

I would recommend this course for a student interested in stellar spectroscopy. There are many other aspects of radiative transfer which were not covered (radiative transfer in the IGM, etc), so the course might not be very useful to such students.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
